trans-unit.source: Specifies the key to use to:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the key to use to:

target.mrk: Specifies the key to use to:

trans-unit.source: Configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption

seg-source.mrk: Configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption

target.mrk: Configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption

trans-unit.source: Specify an alphanumeric string that is at least eight characters long.

seg-source.mrk: Specify an alphanumeric string that is at least eight characters long.

target.mrk: Specify an alphanumeric string that is at least eight characters long.

trans-unit.source: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new database, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the create=true and dataEncryption=true attributes.

seg-source.mrk: When you create a new database, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the create=true and dataEncryption=true attributes.

target.mrk: When you create a new database, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the create=true and dataEncryption=true attributes.

trans-unit.source: When you configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the dataEncryption=true attribute. For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the database owner can perform encryption. Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the for more information.

seg-source.mrk: When you configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the dataEncryption=true attribute.

For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform encryption.
Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: When you configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption, the bootPassword=key attribute must be combined with the dataEncryption=true attribute.

For an existing, unencrypted database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform encryption.
Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

trans-unit.source: The bootPassword=key attribute can optionally be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

seg-source.mrk: The bootPassword=key attribute can optionally be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

target.mrk: The bootPassword=key attribute can optionally be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName, encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm, and/or encryptionKeyLength=length attributes.

trans-unit.source: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- boot an existing encrypted database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing encrypted database for encryption, -- specifying the encryption algorithm jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace; encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding

seg-source.mrk: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- boot an existing encrypted database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing encrypted database for encryption, -- specifying the encryption algorithm jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace; encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding

target.mrk: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:salesdb;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- boot an existing encrypted database jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;bootPassword=cseveryPlace -- configure an existing encrypted database for encryption, -- specifying the encryption algorithm jdbc:derby:encryptedDB;dataEncryption=true;bootPassword=cseveryPlace; encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding
